subject: Re: [junit] nested testsuits.
msgSnippet: Ernst, That is JUnit 4 s behavior.  Since JUnit 4 is much more flexible about how a test class can be defined (with customizeable runners), there s currently
messageBody:
Ernst,

That is JUnit 4's behavior. Since JUnit 4 is much more flexible about
how a test class can be defined (with customizeable runners), there's
currently no appropriate default behavior for interpreting any methods
found in a class used to define a Suite. When I just want to define
multiple related test classes, one technique I use is the Enclosed
runner. The following should have the behavior you want.

Share and Enjoy,

David Saff

@RunWith(Enclosed.class)
public class LinearProblemL2RTest {

public static class TestAll {
@Test public void testDummy() throws Exception {
LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testSubtract();
}
} // class TestAll

public static class TestEquation {
@Test public void testSubtract() throws Exception {
LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testSubtract();
}
@Test public void testScale() throws Exception {
LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testScale();
}
}
public static class TestSystem {
@Test public void testSearchPivot() throws Exception {
LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testSearchPivot();
}
}






ernst.rei3ner wrote:
> hi all,
>
>
> in the meanwhile i found the junit-4-way to use handmade testsuits.
>
> It seems as if a testclass is either a suitclass with no methods
> or is to comprise methods.
>
> Mixing seems not to be possible:
>
> testDummy is just ignored.
>
> or am i making a mistake?
>
> The old style TestSuits worked that way.
>
> greetings
>
> ernst
>
>
>
> @RunWith(Suite.class)
> @SuiteClasses({LinearProblemL2RTest.TestAll.class})
> public class LinearProblemL2RTest {
>
>
> @RunWith(Suite.class)
> @SuiteClasses({
> LinearProblemL2RTest.TestEquation.class,
> LinearProblemL2RTest.TestSystem.class
> })
> public static class TestAll {
> @Test public void testDummy() throws Exception {
> LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testSubtract();
> }
> } // class TestAll
>
> public static class TestEquation {
> @Test public void testSubtract() throws Exception {
> LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testSubtract();
> }
> @Test public void testScale() throws Exception {
> LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testScale();
> }
> }
> public static class TestSystem {
> @Test public void testSearchPivot() throws Exception {
> LinearProblemL2RTest.TEST.testSearchPivot();
> }
> }
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
